column1:
Table 320.20. Certificates below the associate's degree level conferred by postsecondary institutions, by race/ethnicity and
              sex of student: 1998-99 through 2016-17

column2: Number of certificates conferred to U.S. citizens, permanent residents, and nonresident aliens
column10: Percentage distribution of certificates conferred to U.S citizens and permanent residents

column1: NOTE: Includes less-than-1-year awards and 1- to less-than-4-year awards (excluding associate's degrees) conferred by postsecondary institutions participating in Title IV federal financial aid programs. Race categories exclude persons of Hispanic ethnicity. Reported racial/ethnic distributions of students by level of degree, field of degree, and sex were used to estimate race/ethnicity for students whose race/ethnicity was not reported. Some data have been revised from previously published figures. Detail may not sum to totals because of rounding.

SOURCE: U.S. Department of Education, National Center for Education Statistics, Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System (IPEDS), "Completions Survey" (IPEDS-C:99); and IPEDS Fall 2000 through Fall 2017, Completions component. (This table was prepared August 2018.)
